messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Check this out! stolen sword
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Milt. Hope so much for you that this beatiful sword will get back to you. I hope that you make the hassle contacting the police, because ebay is the most
messages.messageBody:
Hi Milt.
Hope so much for you that this beatiful sword will get back to you. I hope that you make the hassle contacting the police, because ebay is the most awful place white-washing money and a place for stolen things where you very eassy get cheeted. My " case " where I boughte a Kiyosada sword from feb. 2004 has just now reached FBI and I am not very possitive about getting the sword I have bought. But I hope that if peable, like I did, report ebay to the police, FBI etc. force ebay to higher the ethical level and make it more secure to use ebay and the Net. All the best wishes for you
Allan
----- Original Message -----
From: bungotakadasword
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, October 11, 2004 12:53 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Re: Check this out! stolen sword



--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, Tom Helm <junkmail@t...> wrote:
> Read the description!
>
> http://tinyurl.com/5afv5
>
>

http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&?
ViewItem&item=2276357713
this is the sword " stolen " ( or missing ) from my hotel room in
Chicago.
To keep life simple ,I am trying to buy it back from the seller with
no question ask.
I do have the shinsa worksheet and pics to prove ownership, so please
do not bid on this item.
I don't want the hassle of contacting Chicago Police, e-Bay etc. if
anyone bid and win this " stolen " item.
Thank you all,

Milt

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Check this out! stolen sword
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/11/2004 8:45:04 AM Central Daylight Time, JapaneseSwords@aol.com writes: I seem to remember that someone on this list knew that you had
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/11/2004 8:45:04 AM Central Daylight Time,
JapaneseSwords@... writes:
I seem to remember that
someone on this list knew that you had left your sword in the shinza room. I
think
someone on this list must know what is going on, but would rather see you
squirm for a bit. Good luck on finding out who it is.

Lou
Cia is tracking him now, he's located in California.

milt


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Check this out! stolen sword
messages.msgSnippet: Hey Milt, There are pictures of two different tangs.  Looks like someone that was at the show is busting your balls.  If they are from Chicago then they must
messages.messageBody:
Hey Milt,
There are pictures of two different tangs. Looks like someone that was
at the show is busting your balls. If they are from Chicago then they must be
part of your local sword study group possibly. I seem to remember that
someone on this list knew that you had left your sword in the shinza room. I think
someone on this list must know what is going on, but would rather see you
squirm for a bit. Good luck on finding out who it is.

Lou


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
